Package org.dark.shaders.light

Class StandardLight

java.lang.Object
org.dark.shaders.light.StandardLight
All Implemented Interfaces:
LightAPI
public class StandardLight extends Object implements LightAPI
A specialization of LightAPI suited for every case wherein the default, automatic lighting behaviors are sufficient.

  • Constructor Details

    • StandardLight

      public StandardLight()
      Constructs a generic light. Note that the light begins with an initial size and intensity of 0.

      Since:
      Beta 1.02

    • StandardLight

      public StandardLight(float intensity, float size)
      Constructs a generic light.

      Parameters:
      intensity - The desired intensity of the light.
      size - The desired size of the light.

      Since:
      Beta 1.07

    • StandardLight

      public StandardLight(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f location, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f velocity, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f offset, com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.CombatEntityAPI attach)
      Constructs a point light. Note that the light begins with an initial size and intensity of 0.

      Parameters:
      location - The desired location for the light.
      velocity - The desired velocity for the light.
      offset - The desired attachment offset for the light.
      attach - The desired light attachment. May be null.

      Since:
      Beta 1.02

    • StandardLight

      public StandardLight(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f location, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f velocity, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f offset, com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.CombatEntityAPI attach, float intensity, float size)
      Constructs a point light.

      velocity - The desired velocity for the light.
      offset - The desired attachment offset for the light.
      attach - The desired light attachment. May be null.
      intensity - The desired intensity of the light.
      size - The desired size of the light.

      Since:
      Beta 1.07

    • StandardLight

      public StandardLight(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f location, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f velocity, com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.BeamAPI beamLink, boolean linkToEnd)
      Constructs a point light, attached to a beam endpoint. Note that the light begins with an initial size and intensity of 0.

      Parameters:
      location - The desired location for the light.
      velocity - The desired velocity for the light.
      beamLink - The desires beam attachment for the light. May be null.
      linkToEnd - Whether to link the light to the end of the beam or not. Ignored if beamLink is null.

      Since:
      Beta 1.02

    • StandardLight

      public StandardLight(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f location, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f velocity, com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.BeamAPI beamLink, boolean linkToEnd, float intensity, float size)
      Constructs a point light, attached to a beam endpoint.

      Parameters:
      location - The desired location for the light.
      velocity - The desired velocity for the light.
      beamLink - The desires beam attachment for the light. May be null.
      linkToEnd - Whether to link the light to the end of the beam or not. Ignored if beamLink is null.
      intensity - The desired intensity of the light.
      size - The desired size of the light.

      Since:
      Beta 1.07

    • StandardLight

      public StandardLight(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f location, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f location2, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f velocity, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f velocity2, com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.BeamAPI beamAttach)
      Constructs a line light. Note that the light begins with an initial size and intensity of 0.

      Parameters:
      location - The desired origin location for the light.
      location2 - The desired endpoint location for the light.
      velocity - The desired velocity for the light's origin.
      velocity2 - The desired velocity for the light's endpoint.
      beamAttach - The beam attachment for the light. May be null.

      Since:
      Beta 1.02

    • StandardLight

      public StandardLight(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f location, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f velocity, float arcEnd, float arcStart)
      Constructs a cone light. Note that the light begins with an initial size and intensity of 0.

      Parameters:
      location - The desired location for the light.
      velocity - The desired velocity for the light.
      arcEnd - The desired end of the visible arc of the light, in degrees.
      arcStart - The desired start of the visible arc of the light, in degrees.

      Since:
      Beta 1.02

  • Method Details

    • computeOffset

      protected static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f computeOffset(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f location, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f offset, float angle)

    • advance

      public boolean advance(float amount)
      Runs once per frame.

      Specified by:
      advance in interface LightAPI
      Parameters:
      amount - Seconds since last frame.

      Returns:
      True if the light should be destroyed this frame, false if it should not be destroyed this frame.

    • attachTo

      public void attachTo(com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.CombatEntityAPI attach)
      Attaches the light to an entity. Will unlatch the light from any other attachments.

      Parameters:
      attach - The entity to attach to.

    • attachToBeam

      public void attachToBeam(com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.BeamAPI beamAttach)
      Attaches the light to a beam. Will unlatch the light from any other attachments.

      Parameters:
      beamAttach - The beam to attach to.

    • fadeIn

      public void fadeIn(float seconds)
      Fades in the light over a period of time. This method will also temporarily zero-out the light's intensity.

      Parameters:
      seconds - The period of time desired for the light to fade in over. If zero, will immediately complete an existing fade-in.

    • fadeOut

      public void fadeOut(float seconds)
      Fades the light out over a period of time. Giving a negative or zero value will cause the light to instantly disappear.

      Parameters:
      seconds - The period of time desired for the light to fade out over. A negative or zero value will cause the light to instantly disappear.

    • getArcEnd

      public float getArcEnd()
      The end of the current visible arc of the light, in degrees. Only used for cone-type lights.

      Specified by:
      getArcEnd in interface LightAPI
      Returns:
      The current facing direction of the light.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.4

    • getArcStart

      public float getArcStart()
      The start of the current visible arc of the light, in degrees. Only used for cone-type lights.

      Specified by:
      getArcStart in interface LightAPI
      Returns:
      The start of the current visible arc of the light, in degrees.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.4

    • getAttachment

      public com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.CombatEntityAPI getAttachment()
      Gets the entity that the light is attached to.

      Returns:
      The entity that the light is attached to. Returns null if there is no such attachment.

    • getAutoFadeOutTime

      public float getAutoFadeOutTime()
      Gets the time the light takes to fade out if it is automatically flagged to fade out by the lighting system.

      Returns:
      The time the light takes to fade out if it is automatically flagged to fade out by the lighting system.

    • setAutoFadeOutTime

      public void setAutoFadeOutTime(float autoFadeOutTime)
      Sets the time the light takes to fade out if it is automatically flagged to fade out by the lighting system.

      Parameters:
      autoFadeOutTime - The time desired for the light to take to fade out if it is automatically flagged to fade out by the lighting system.

    • getBeamAttachment

      public com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.BeamAPI getBeamAttachment()
      Gets the beam that the light is attached to.

      Returns:
      The beam that the light is attached to. Returns null if there is no such attachment.

    • getBeamLink

      public com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.BeamAPI getBeamLink()
      Gets the location that the light is attached to, if it is attached to a beam's origin or endpoint.

      Returns:
      The origin or endpoint of a beam that the light is attached to. Returns null if there is no such attachment.

    • getColor

      public org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f getColor()
      Gets the light's color.

      Specified by:
      getColor in interface LightAPI
      Returns:
      An object whose xyz components correspond to rgb, in terms of values between 0.0 and 1.0.

    • setColor

      public void setColor(Color color)
      Sets the light to a particular color.

      Parameters:
      color - The color to set the light to, given by a Color object.

    • setColor

      public void setColor(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f color)
      Sets the light to a particular color.

      Parameters:
      color - The color to set the light to, given by an object whose xyz components correspond to rgb. Uses values between 0.0 and 1.0.

    • getDirection

      public org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f getDirection()
      Gets the light's directional vector. Only used for directional-type lights.

      Specified by:
      getDirection in interface LightAPI
      Returns:
      The light's directional vector.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.4

    • setDirection

      Sets the light's directional vector. Only used for directional-type lights.

      Parameters:

      Since:
      Alpha 1.4

    • getHeight

      public float getHeight()
      Gets the height of the light, in world-space units. Only used for the purposes of normal maps.

      Specified by:
      getHeight in interface LightAPI
      Returns:
      The world-space height of the light.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.4

    • setHeight

      public void setHeight(float height)
      Sets the height of the light, in world-space units. Only used for the purposes of normal maps.

      Parameters:
      height - The world-space height of the light.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.4

    • getIntensity

      public float getIntensity()
      Gets the light's intensity.

      Specified by:
      getIntensity in interface LightAPI
      Returns:
      The light's intensity, in terms of lumens at the center of the light. This value is modulated by the brightness of the beam it is attached to, if any.

    • setIntensity

      public void setIntensity(float intensity)
      Sets the light's intensity. A value of 1 will increase the luminosity of the pixel at the center of the light by 1 times the pixel's current luminosity (e.g. a luminosity of 0.5 will become 1.0). This formula may change if materials are added in the future.

      Parameters:
      intensity - The desired intensity of the light.

    • setLifetime

      public void setLifetime(float lifetime)
      Gives the light a lifetime timer. If the timer runs out, the light will fade or disappear, depending on parameters. Lights last forever by default. Lifetime will only decrement when the light is not fading.

      Parameters:
      lifetime - The desired lifetime for the light.

    • getLocation

      public org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f getLocation()
      Gets the current location of the light.

      Specified by:
      getLocation in interface LightAPI
      Returns:
      The current location of the light, with respect to attachments.

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f location)
      Sets the location of the light. Has no effect if the light is attached to something.

      Parameters:
      location - The location to set the light to.

    • getLocation2

      public org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f getLocation2()
      Gets the current location of the light's secondary endpoint. Only used for line-type lights.

      Specified by:
      getLocation2 in interface LightAPI
      Returns:
      The current location of the light's secondary endpoint, with respect to attachments.

    • setLocation2

      public void setLocation2(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f location)
      Sets the secondary endpoint of the light. Only used for line-type lights. Has no effect if the light is attached to something.

      Parameters:
      location - The secondary endpoint of the light.

    • getOffset

      public org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f getOffset()
      Gets the attachment offset of the light.

      Returns:
      The attachment offset of the light, ignoring attachment rotation.

    • setOffset

      public void setOffset(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f offset)
      Sets the attachment offset of the light. Note that this will offset both location vectors. Has no effect if the light is not attached to something. Does not work with beam attachments.

      Parameters:
      offset - The attachment offset to give the light, before attachment rotation.

    • getRemainingLifetime

      public float getRemainingLifetime()
      Gets the remaining time the light has before it fades or disappears, depending on parameters.

      Returns:
      The remaining time the light has before it fades or disappears, depending on parameters.

    • getSize

      public float getSize()
      Gets the light's size.

      Specified by:
      getSize in interface LightAPI
      Returns:
      The light's size, in units.

    • setSize

      public void setSize(float size)
      Sets the light's size.

      Parameters:
      size - The size to set the light to, in units.

    • getSpecularIntensity

      public float getSpecularIntensity()
      Gets the specular intensity of the light. Only used for directional-type lights.

      Specified by:
      getSpecularIntensity in interface LightAPI
      Returns:
      The specular intensity of the light.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.4

    • setSpecularIntensity

      public void setSpecularIntensity(float intensity)
      Sets the specular intensity of the light. Only used for directional-type lights.

      Parameters:
      intensity - The specular intensity of the light.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.4

    • getSpecularMult

      Since:

    • getType

      public int getType()
      Gets the light's type.

      Specified by:
      getType in interface LightAPI
      Returns:
      The light's current type. Type 0: point light (default). Type 1: line light. Type 2: cone light. Type 3: directional light.

    • setType

      public void setType(int type)
      Sets the light's type.

      Parameters:
      type - The type of light to set it to. Type 0: point light (default). Type 1: line light. Type 2: cone light. Type 3: directional light.

    • getVelocity

      public org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f getVelocity()
      Gets the current velocity of the light. Returns zero if the light is attached to anything.

      Returns:
      The current velocity of the light.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.2

    • setVelocity

      public void setVelocity(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f velocity)
      Sets the velocity for the light. Has no effect if the light is attached to something.

      Parameters:
      velocity - The velocity to apply to the light.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.2

    • getVelocity2

      public org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f getVelocity2()
      Gets the current velocity of the secondary endpoint of the light. Only used for line-type lights. Returns zero if the light is attached to anything.

      Returns:
      The current velocity of the light's secondary endpoint.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.2

    • setVelocity2

      public void setVelocity2(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f velocity)
      Sets the velocity for the secondary endpoint of the light. Only used for line-type lights. Has no effect if the light is attached to something.

      Parameters:
      velocity - The velocity to apply to the secondary endpoint of the light.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.2

    • isFadingIn

      public boolean isFadingIn()
      Returns whether the light is fading in or not.

      Returns:
      Whether the light is fading in or not.

    • isFadingOut

      public boolean isFadingOut()
      Returns whether the light is fading out or not.

      Returns:
      Whether the light is fading out or not.

    • linkToBeam

      public void linkToBeam(com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.BeamAPI beamLink, boolean linkToEnd)
      Attaches the light to the origin or the endpoint of a beam. Will unlatch the light from any other attachments.

      Parameters:
      beamLink - The beam to attach to the origin or endpoint of.
      linkToEnd - Whether the light should be attached to the beam's origin or its endpoint.

    • makePermanent

      public void makePermanent()
      Makes the light permanent. This sets the lifetime of the light to -1 and sets the internal failsafe lifetime to -1 as well, making it truly permanent until destroyed or otherwise made mortal. By default, lights disappear after one minute to avoid "light leaks".

      Since:
      Alpha 1.62

    • setArc

      public void setArc(float start, float end)
      Sets the visible arc of the light, in degrees. Only used for cone-type lights.

      Parameters:
      start - The start of the light's visible arc, in degrees.
      end - The end of the light's visible arc, in degrees.

      Since:
      Alpha 1.4

    • setColor

      public void setColor(float red, float green, float blue)
      Sets the light to a particular color.

      Parameters:
      red - The red component to set the light to. Uses a value between 0.0 and 1.0.
      green - The green component to set the light to. Uses a value between 0.0 and 1.0.
      blue - The blue component to set the light to. Uses a value between 0.0 and 1.0.

    • unattach

      public void unattach()
      Unlatches the light from any attachments.

    • getIntensityFade

      Gets the change in intensity over time.

      Returns:

      Since:

    • setIntensityFade

      public void setIntensityFade(float intensityFade)
      Sets the change in intensity over time.

      Parameters:
      intensityFade - The rate of change of intensity to apply to the light. Positive for fade-in, negative for fade-out, zero for no fading.

      Since:
      1.8.0
